talk.author: did:plc:tefudx2goyyuhl6nttbfa4yd
talk.utter: No, the possible reasoning I’m noting has to do with the open division being more competitive than the women’s division because the best women’s players compete in the open division.

talk.author: did:plc:o3o4uv5qav4zqvstn4rov27e
talk.utter: What? You're saying men would identify as women to cheat. That would require men being inherently better at chess. Else it wouldn't be cheating. Idk why you're struggling with this?

talk.author: did:plc:tefudx2goyyuhl6nttbfa4yd
talk.utter:
First, I’m not saying men would identify as women to cheat. Stop putting words in my mouth. 

Second, no, you simply do not understand how chess competitions work: the best women players compete in the open division, which means they don’t compete in the women’s division.

talk.author: did:plc:tefudx2goyyuhl6nttbfa4yd
talk.utter:
First, I’m not saying men would identify as women to cheat. Stop putting words in my mouth. 

Second, no, you simply do not understand how chess competitions work: the best women players compete in the open division, which means they don’t compete in the women’s division.

talk.author: did:plc:o3o4uv5qav4zqvstn4rov27e
talk.utter: Why on earth do you think that's relevant to or in any way excuses their decision to ban trans women from the women's division?

talk.author: did:plc:tefudx2goyyuhl6nttbfa4yd
talk.utter: I never said nor implied that is excuses their decision. Please learn to read.

talk.author: did:plc:tefudx2goyyuhl6nttbfa4yd
talk.utter: I never said nor implied that is excuses their decision. Please learn to read.

talk.author: did:plc:o3o4uv5qav4zqvstn4rov27e
talk.utter: You came up with a rationalisation that you thought could explain this without implying inherent sex differences. But your explanation still implies them.
